caption: This is a beautiful garden even in the middle of December. I can only imagine what it must look like in the spring and summer! There is a Christmas market here and it’s just food and carnival rides very few crafts. It was pretty with the lights, however.  It was very, very crowded at night!

Located in the 1st in front of the Louvre, these gardens are massive, and absolutely stunning, during every visit of Paris we always end up here, it is the perfect place for a picnic, there is seating literally everywhere, as the there are portable chairs scattered around, you can sit in the shade, or by one of the many ponds.

Beautiful gardens; great area to walk before or after visiting the Louvre.  No ticket/ Louvre visit is needed to walk the garden paths.  Keep in mind that they close off large areas for the Olympics and other events.

This is one of Paris' most beautiful and famous landmarks. It is an immense green space with artificial bodies of water where you can relax and go for a walk. It is aligned in a straight line with La Défense,  the Arc of Triumph,  Place de la Concorde, and the Louvre. The only downside I see here is the gravel and dusty ground that really gets your shoes dirty.
An amazing sprawling garden! I enjoyed spending time here with my family!
Super spot.

The gardens are located just after the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel. It is used by Parisians for walking, running and picnicking as well as for breathing clean air. There are also several benches and chairs where you can relax.

A very beautiful garden! At the moment (August 2024), the latter is temporarily closed to welcome the Olympic flame! Otherwise, the garden is very beautiful to visit and many places are available to sit and rest. I recommend!
It really looks like from a distance that it is a flame even though they are bulbs made by Engie. It's even nicer at night
Gardens that I believe will be exquisite in spring. Now it's a lot of fun with the Christmas market right next door.

The Jardin des Tuileries is a beautiful green space that offers a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. The tree-lined paths and manicured gardens are perfect for strolling or relaxing on a bench. Sculptures and fountains add an artistic touch to the environment. It is an ideal place for a picnic or simply to enjoy a good book. Although there may be many visitors, the atmosphere remains serene and pleasant. A must-see for anyone looking to reconnect with nature in Paris!

Place for walks and picnics for many visitors. Ideal for going from the Lou Re pyramids to Concorde. Beautiful view of the illuminated Eiffel Tower and now, the place where the Olympic cauldron takes off... magnificent!!!
Very beautiful park where it is good to walk, whatever the weather. With a preference all the same for sunny days.
Very beautiful garden to walk around and have a good time, very clean and well maintained despite everyone passing through.
A place to be quiet in the center of the city. It's big and majestic
Despite the very friendly crowds for the Christmas holidays… we appreciate the show offered for the children

When I enter the Tuileries Garden, I am immediately struck by an atmosphere of calm and peace. The shape of the garden is so harmonious that I immediately feel at home. The perfectly trimmed hedges and symmetrical paths invite me to walk further and explore the beauty around me.  The garden stretches majestically between the Louvre and Place de la Concorde, and I can't help but think about the history that connects these sites. I walk on the wide gravel paths and enjoy the fresh air. On both sides there are magnificent flower beds with bright colors that breathe life into the garden. I stop to admire the variety of flowers - from delicate tulips to vibrant lilies. Its scent mixes with the fresh green of the plants and I breathe in deeply.  In the middle of the garden I discover a large pond surrounded by elegant chairs. E Some people sit there and enjoy the sun while others play with their children. I find a free spot on one of the benches and sit down. It's a perfect place to take in the surroundings. I watch the small boats floating on the water and the gentle sound of the water has a calming effect. The sculptures and fountains scattered throughout the garden add an artistic touch to the view.  As I continue to stroll through the garden, I pass a pretty café. The smell of freshly brewed coffee and pastries draws me in and I consider taking a short break. The tables are set up outside and I can easily imagine sitting here, enjoying a coffee and watching the hustle and bustle around me.  I notice how the garden is not only a place for relaxation, but also a vibrant part of the city. People jog, couples walk hand in hand, and tourists take photos of the scenic scenes. It is this vibrant lifestyle that makes the Tuileries Garden so special.  As the sun slowly sets and the golden light falls over the hedges and statues, I find myself drawn to the beauty of this place. The Tuileries Garden is not just a garden; It is a place of retreat, a place full of history and culture, which gives me the opportunity to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a moment and unwind.  August 11, 2023
Traveled at night, in December. Next door there was the Christmas market! It was quite magical! Looking forward to seeing this garden, in broad daylight!
Impossible to approach the flame, the barriers are completely useless, it would be better to put the barriers only around the flame, that would be much simpler.
Every giant should have longer opening hours

Very good memory
Christmas market
